channel.title: Aug
channel.description: Day By Day VA Family-Literacy Calendar

item.title: August Monthly Activities
item.description:
Books to Read!

• The Little Bird Who Loved To Take A Bath by Bonnie Kuntz and J. Austin Jennings
• Mind Your Manners, Biscuit! by Alyssa Satin Capucilli and Pat Schories
• Maggie Mouse Can't Sleep by Haley Moonspur and S. Kalinauskaite
• Monsters Don't Eat Broccoli by Barbara Jean Hicks and Sue Hendra
• Felix Feels Better by Rosemary Wells
• One Was Johnnyl A Counting Book by Maurice Sendak
• The Icky Bug Counting Book by Jerry Pallotta
• Gingerbread Friends by Jan Brett
• Oola, The Owl Who Lost Her Hoot! by Make Believe Ideas
• Daisy the Donut Fairy by Tim Bugbird
• Paulette, The Pinkest Puppy In the World by Make Believe Ideas
• Hubert's Hair Raising Adventure by Bill Peet
• Twirly Pearly by Tim Bugbird
• Waiting For the Magic by Patricia MacLachlan and Amy June Bates
• A Snicker of Magic by Natalie Lloyd
• Half Magic by Edward Eager and N. M. Bodecker
• Puff, The Magic Dragon by Peter Yarrow and Lenny Lipton
• Mrs. Piggle Wiggle's Magic by Betty Macdonald and Hilary Knight
• Look! I Can Tie My Shoes! by Susan Hood and Amy Wummer
• Dr. Seuss's ABC: An Amazing Alphabet Book! by Dr. Seuss
• The Sleepy Little Alphabet: A Bedtime Story From Alphabet Town by Judy Sierra and Melissa Sweet
• Goodnight, Little Monster by Helen Ketteman and Bonnie Leick
• My Monster Mama Loves Me So by Laura Leuck and Mark Buchner
• Wemberly Worried by Kevin Henkes
• Harry, The Dirty Dog by Gene Zion and Margaret Bloy Graham
• I Miss You, Stinky Face by Lisa McCourt and Cyd Moore
• Hooper Humperdink . . .? Not Him! by Dr. Seuss (as Theo LeSieg) and Scott Nash
• How Do Lions Say I Love You? by Diane Muldrow and David Walker
• Bedtime For Mommy by Amy Krouse Rosenthal and Le Uyen Pham

Artwork by Patrick Girouard iREAD 2014 Summer Reading Program

Around VA

Check out Festivals and Events happening in August around the state.

  • BrickFair Chantilly - Chantilly
  • Wytheville Summer Farmers Market - Wytheville
  • Fishersville Summer Indoor Outdoor Market and Yard Sale - Fishersville
  • Doswell Summer Gun Show - Doswell
  • Augusta County Fair - Fishersville
  • Arlington County Fair - Arlington
  • Steppin' Out - Blacksburg
  • Martinsville First Friday Summer Art Walk - Martinsville
  • Smith River Fest - Axon
  • Second Saturday Artful Flea - Chincoteague Island
  • Clarke County Fair - Berryville
  • Prince William County Fair - Manassas
  • Fredericksburg Family Fest - Fredericksburg
  • Luckett's Fair - Leesburg
  • Rockingham County Fair - Harrisonburg
  • Town Center Town Fair - Virginia Beach
  • Deltaville Fall Farmers Market - Deltaville
  • Norfolk Latino Music Festival - Norfolk
  • Richmond Summer Gun Show - Richmond
  • Carroll County Agricultural Fair - Hillsville
  • Shenandoah County Fair - Woodstock
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 31
item.description:
Sing a Song

Five Green Dragons

Five green dragons making such a roar.
One danced away and then there were four.
Four green dragons dancing around a tree.
One danced away and then there were three.
Three green dragons dancing around you.
One danced away and then there were two.
Two green dragons dancing in the sun.
One danced away and then there was one.
One green dragon having lots of fun
She danced away and then there were none.

Watch

Dragon Dance

Try This

Help your child make sock puppets and act out a skit. Sock puppets can be as simple as using a sock and putting it on your hand to make a mouth. Or you can work with your child to decorate a sock with buttons for eyes, coloring the sock with markers, and other embellishments.

TumbleBooks

Red is a Dragon - Roseanne Thong

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Dragon Paper Crafts - Make your very own Chinese Dragon puppet!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 30
item.description:
Sing a Song

Jump rope while you chant this:

Pebble in your hand
Pebbles in your shoe.
Pebbles in your pocket
How many have you?
One, two, three, etc...

Here is another jump rope rhyme:

Cinderella Dressed in Yellow

Cinderella dressed in yellow
Went to kiss a prince,
By mistake,
Kissed a snake.
How many doctors
Did it take,
Was it,
One!, Two!, Three!, Four!, Five…

Watch

Have You Ever Been Fishing?

Try This

Read a fairy tale (or two) together. If you don’t have any, make up a story about a character from a fairy tale.

TumbleBooks

Jack and the Beanstalk - Brandon Steen

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Make a Bean Mosaic - Use beans from the kitchen to make a mosaic!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 29
item.description:
There's a Hole in the Bucket

There's a hole in the bucket, dear Liza, dear Liza,
There's a hole in the bucket, dear Liza, there's a hole.

Then fix it dear Henry, dear Henry, dear Henry,
Then fix it dear Henry, dear Henry, fix it.

With what shall I fix it, dear Liza, dear Liza,
With what shall I fix it, dear Liza, with what?

With straw, dear Henry, dear Henry, dear Henry,
With straw, dear Henry, dear Henry, with straw.

But the straw is too long, dear Liza, dear Liza,
The straw is too long, dear Liza, too long.

Then cut it dear Henry, dear Henry, dear Henry,
Then cut it dear Henry, dear Henry, cut it.

With what shall I cut it, dear Liza, dear Liza,
With what shall I cut it, dear Liza, with what?

With an ax, dear Henry, dear Henry, dear Henry,
With an ax, dear Henry, dear Henry, an ax.

But the ax is too dull, dear Liza, dear Liza,
The ax is too dull, dear Liza, too dull.

Then, sharpen it, dear Henry, dear Henry, dear Henry,
Then sharpen it dear Henry, dear Henry, sharpen it!

With what shall I sharpen it, dear Liza, dear Liza,
With what shall I sharpen, dear Liza, with what?

With a stone, dear Henry, dear Henry, dear Henry,
With a stone, dear Henry, dear Henry, a stone.

But the stone is too dry, dear Liza, dear Liza,
The stone is too dry, dear Liza, too dry.

Then wet it, dear Henry, dear Henry, dear Henry,
Then wet it dear Henry, dear Henry, wet it.

With what shall I wet it, dear Liza, dear Liza,
With what shall I wet it, dear Liza, with what?

With water, dear Henry, dear Henry, dear Henry,
With water, dear Henry, dear Henry, with water.

In what shall I carry it, dear Liza, dear Liza,
In what shall I carry it, dear Liza, in what?

In a bucket, dear Henry, dear Henry, dear Henry,
In a bucket, dear Henry, dear Henry, in a bucket!

But there's a hole in the bucket, dear Liza, dear Liza,
There's a hole in the bucket, dear Liza, a hole.

TumbleBooks

Matthew and the Midnight Tow Truck - Allen Morgan

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Imagine that a box or laundry basket is a car for your child. Make car noises and talk about the parts of the car.

Watch

PBS Kids: Clifford and the Traffic Jam

Explore More

  • Make a Car from a Cardboard Box - Transform an ordinary cardboard box into a customized car!
  • Make a Balloon Car - This car can really move! Please have adult supervision for blowing up the balloon.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 28
item.description:
Sing a Song

Shoo, Fly, Don't Bother Me

Shoo, fly, don't bother me,
Shoo, fly, don't bother me,
Shoo, fly, don't bother me,
For I belong to somebody!

I feel, I feel, I feel,
I feel like a morning star,
I feel, I feel, I feel,
I feel like a morning star.

Sooooo, Shoo, fly, don't bother me,
Shoo, fly, don't bother me,
Shoo, fly, don't bother me,
For I belong to somebody!

TumbleBooks

The Clever Boy and the Terrible, Dangerous Animal - Idries Shah

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

A Family Masterpiece! Cover the floor with paper and have everyone draw to make one large picture. If you have small pieces of paper, then make a family paper quilt.

Watch

PBS Kids: Grandparents’ Day: an Arthur Movie

Explore More

  • Make a Quilt Pattern Collage - With a little bit of preparation cutting magazines, you can help your child make interesting mosaics for placemats and more.
  • The Green Grass Grew All Around - Sing along with this catchy tune.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 27
item.description:
Crackers and Crumbs

Crackers and crumbs
(pretend to eat a cracker and brush the crumbs off your shirt)
Crackers and crumbs
(pretend to eat a cracker and brush the crumbs off your shirt)
These are my fingers
(show fingers)
These are my thumbs
(thumbs up)
These are my eyes
(point to eyes)
These are my ears
(point to ears)
They'll all grow bigger
(put hands down by floor and stretch up for last two lines)
In the next few years

TumbleBooks

Pet Peeves - Sarah Willson

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Set up a pretend fruit and vegetable stand. Talk about how many things your child will “buy.”

Watch

Sesame Street: Healthy Snacks

Explore More

  • Plant a Bean - Beans make great first plants as they are easy and fast to grow!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 26
item.description:
Do Your Ears Hang Low?

Song night! Sing Do Your Ears Hang Low? with hand motions.

Do your ears hang low?
Do they wobble to and fro?
Can you tie them in a knot?
Can you tie them in a bow?
Can you throw them o'er your shoulder
Like a Continental Soldier?
Do your ears hang low?

Watch

{wmvremote}http://web3.scetv.org/instant_replay/ew_marionette.wmv{/wmvremote}

Marionette Puppets

Try This

Use your fingers to make bunnies. Act out a finger play that you make up!

TumbleBooks

Caillou Puts Away His Toys - Joceline Sanschagrin

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Make a Juice Box Planter - You can turn a juice box into a planter for a flower or other plant.
  • Barnyard Babies - Watch, listen, and read along to this story about the babies that live on the farm.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 25
item.description:
Mother Goose Time!

Do the hand motions to Hickory Dickory Dock.

Hickory, Dickory, Dock.
The mouse ran up the clock.
The clock struck one.
The mouse ran down.
Hickory, Dickory, Dock.

Watch

Peter Peter Pumpkin Eater

Try This

Create a made up animal from salt dough. What does it look like? What is it called and why?

TumbleBooks

Mahalia Mouse Goes To College - John Lithgow

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Make a Rock Creature - A simple rock with a little paint and creativity can become a funny pal!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 24
item.description:
Sing a Song

Tool Time

Peter works with (one fist moving up and down)
1 hammer, 1 hammer, 1 hammer
Peter works with one hammer, now he works with 2.
Peter works with 2 hammers, etc. (two fists)
Peter works with 3 hammers, etc. (two fists & one foot)
Peter works with 4 hammers, etc. (two fists & two feet)
Peter works with (two fists, two feet & head nodding)
5 hammers, 5 hammers, 5 hammers
Peter works with 5 hammers,
Now his work is done.

TumbleBooks

The Biggest Job of All - Harriet Ziefert

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Help your child use dolls, action figures, or stuffed animals to act out a story.

Watch

Monster Rhyme

Explore More

  • Doctor Maisy - This Maisy story can be read aloud by a parent or older sibling.
  • How to Make a Yarn Doll - Did you know you can make your own doll using nothing but yarn, scissors, and a piece of cardboard?
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 23
item.description:
Sing a Song

Two Little Blackbirds

Two little blackbirds
(Hold up both pointer fingers)
Sitting on a hill,
(Or put hands ‘sitting up’ on shoulders)
One named Jack,
(Move one hand forward)
One named Jill,
(Move other hand forward)
Fly away, Jack
(Move one hand behind back)
Fly away, Jill
(Move other hand behind back)
Come back, Jack,
(Bring hands back, one by one)
Come back, Jill.

TumbleBooks

Beautiful Moon - Dawn Jeffers

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Read a book with your child. Ask him or her to imagine what happens after the book ends.

Watch

If I Were a Fish

Explore More

  • Make a Whale of a Tale - Draw a whale then think of a story of the adventures this whale might go on.
  • Make a Story - In this interactive story, you get to pick what happens!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 22
item.description:
Sing a Song

The Field Trip Rhyme

Next time you go on a trip (even a short one across town), try singing this song and adding what you and your child might see on the way.

Going on a field trip,
Leaving right away.
If we could, we'd stay all day!
Going to the [name of destination]
What will we see?
Use your imagination;
Now tell me.
We might see a _______ and we might see a _______
And we might see a _______ and a _______ .
We might see a _______ and we might see a _______
And we might see a _______ and a _______ .

TumbleBooks

The Journey of Oliver K. Woodman - Darcy Pattison

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Travel in your mind! Help your child use his or her imagination to go on a South Carolina trip. Where would you go? What would you see?

Watch

Ready to Read: Baby Elephant at the Zoo

Explore More

  • Storybird - Use Storybird to make your own travel story.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 21
item.description:
Boom, Boom, Ain't It Great to be Crazy

Chorus:
Boom, boom, ain't it great to be crazy?
Boom, boom, ain't it great to be crazy?
Giddy and foolish the whole day through
Boom, boom, ain't it great to be crazy?

A horse and a flea and three blind mice
Sat on a curbstone shooting dice
The horse he slipped and fell on the flea,
"Whoops," said the flea, "there’s a horse on me!"

Chorus

Way down South where bananas grow
A flea stepped on an elephant's toe
The elephant cried, with tears in his eyes
"Why don't you pick on someone your own size?"

Chorus

Way up North where there's ice and snow
There lived a penguin and his name was Joe
He got so tired of black and white
He wore pink slacks to the dance last night!
Chorus (do twice)

TumbleBooks

Pirates Don't Change Diapers - Melinda Long

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Do you have old clothes? Play dress up together and put on a little show. If you have babies, play peek-a-boo with a handkerchief.

Watch

Clothes Don't Make the Dog

Explore More

  • The Lady with the Alligator Purse - When the baby starts acting funny, guess who comes to visit?
  • Yarn Cards - Make a card decorated with colorful yarn.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 20
item.description:
ABC Your Name

Tune: ABCs

ABCDEFG
If your name starts with one of these
Jump and clap and slap your knee
Spin and flap and shout yippee (YIPPEE!)
ABCDEFG
Show us if your name starts with one of these.

HIJKLMNOP
If your name starts with one of these
Jump and clap and slap your knee
Spin and flap and shout yippee (YIPPEE!)
HIJKLMNOP
Show us if your name starts with one of these.

QRST down to Z
If your name starts with one of these
Jump and clap and slap your knee
Spin and flap and shout yippee (YIPPEE!)
QRST down to Z
Show us if your name starts with one of these.

TumbleBooks

The Bears We Know - Brenda Silsbe

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Play The Guessing Box! Use a tissue box or cut a hole in a box. Pick out items together to put in the box. Let your child put his or her hand into the box and without looking, guess what the object is. Encourage your child to describe the way the object feels using words like soft, hard, bumpy, smooth, or squishy.

Watch

Dinosaur Rhyme

Explore More

  • Kerpoof - Draw a bear or a dinosaur with Kerpoof, a great online art studio for kids!
  • Marble Painting and Straw Painting - You can paint with more than just a brush. Try painting with a marble or blowing through a straw.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 19
item.description:
A Sweeping We Will Go

Tune: A Hunting We Will Go

A sweeping we will go
A sweeping we will go
Hi ho the derry-oh
A sweeping we will go

Watch

Who Took the Cookie from the Cookie Jar

Try This

Set up a pretend kitchen and cook something with your child. Talk about keeping things clean and washing your hands.

TumbleBooks

Boy Soup - Loris Lesynski

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Cooking with Kids - Pick a recipe to make today!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 18
item.description:
Sing a Song

Bubble Bath

Tune: Eensy Weensy Spider

Once I’m in my bubble bath
I like to stir up more.
Half the suds go in my eyes
And half go on the floor.
The fun is in the bubbles ‘cause
They jiggle on my skin.
And when I stick them on my face
They dangle from my chin.

Watch

The Amazing Bubble Man

Try This

Make bubble solution with dish detergent. Sit outside together and blow bubbles. Do you see any shapes in the bubbles floating by?

TumbleBooks

The Boy in the Drawer - Robert Munsch

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Make your Own Bubbles - This page is full of bubble activities, from bubble mix recipes, games, hints for big bubbles, and more.
  • Make Soap Bubble Art - Blow bubbles and make a work of art to proudly display!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 17
item.description:
Sing a Song

It Is Snowing

Tune: Frere Jacques

It is snowing, it is snowing
Falling down, falling down
Winter winds are blowing
Drifts are slowly growing
All around, all around

TumbleBooks

He Came With the Couch - David Slonim

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Talk about how August makes you and your child feel. Then pretend it is winter. How does your child feel now?

Watch

PBS Kids: Sid Tells the Weather

Explore More

  • Make Fake Snow! - Here is an easy recipe for snow to add to any art project.
  • Cupcake Liner Snowman - Decorate your snowman with markers, crayons, glitter, or any other art materials you have around the house!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 16
item.description:
Sing a Song

Touch My Hair

I touch my hair, my lips, my eyes.
I sit up straight; then I rise.
I touch my ears, my nose, my chin,
And then I sit back down again.

TumbleBooks

Art's Supplies - Chris Tougas

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Ask your child what he or she would like to be when he or she grows up. Then draw a picture together showing the job.

Watch

People Work

Explore More

  • Community Helpers - Color a picture of a community helper -- You pick one!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 15
item.description:
Sing a Song

Flowers

Flowers tall,
(fingers up)
Flowers small,
(fingers down)
Count them one by one,
1,2,3,4,5,
(touch as you count)
Blowing with the breezes,
(sway side to side)
In the springtime sun!
(arms above head in circle)

TumbleBooks

Perfect Season for Dreaming - Benjamin Alire Sáenz

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Help your child pretend you are both seeds and then grow into a flower. Sing The Farmer in the Dell.

Watch

{mp3remote}http://www.archive.org/download/childrens_short_works_001_0809_librivox/kidsshortworks001_farmersboy_ds_64kb.mp3{/mp3remote}

The Farmer’s Boy

Explore More

  • Giant Tissue Paper Flowers - These tissue paper flowers can be made on a huge scale!
  • Growing Flowers from Bulbs - Grow a potted garden with bulbs or seeds from fruit such as apples, oranges, or even an avocado.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 14
item.description:
Ten Little Fingers

I have ten little fingers and they all belong to me,
I can make them do things-would you like to see?
I can shut them up tight, I can open them wide,
I can put them together, I can make them all hide.
I can make them jump high,
I can make them jump low.
I can fold them up quietly and hold them just so.

TumbleBooks

Clever Beatrice - Margaret Willey

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Read a book and ask your child to imagine what would have happened if the characters in the story made different choices.

Watch

Bananas in Pyjamas Sing-a-long

Explore More

  • Mrs. P's Magic Library - Mrs. P's magic library has games, activities, and lots of videos with stories read by Mrs. P.
  • Neighborhood Story - Click on three of these pictures and make your own story of what happens.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 13
item.description:
Sing a Song

Boom Boom Ain’t it Great to Be Crazy

Chorus:
Boom boom ain't it great to be crazy,
Boom boom ain't it great to be nuts like you,
Silly and foolish all day long,
Boom boom ain't it great to be crazy.

A way up north in the ice and snow,
there was a penguin and his name was Joe
He got so tired of black and white,
That he wore pink tights to the party last night

Chorus

A horsey and a flea and three blind mice,
were sittin' on a tombstone shootin' dice.
The horsey slipped and fell on the flea,
"Whoops!" said that the flea,"there's a horsey on me."

Chorus

Way up north where bananas grow,
an ant stepped on an elephant's toe,
the elephant cried with tears in his eyes,
"Why don't you pick on a guy your own size?"

Chorus

TumbleBooks

Ish - Peter Reynolds

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Let your child “paint” on the sidewalk or dirt using water, and watch it evaporate. If you have chalk, you can also write with chalk.

Watch

PBS Kids: You Can Never Go Down the Drain

Explore More

  • How to Make your Own Sidewalk Art - If you have a sidewalk or other walkway that can be easily washed off, make it the easel for your next big masterpiece.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 12
item.description:
Sing a Song

Shortning Bread

Put on the skillet, slip on the lid,
Mama's gonna make a little short'nin' bread.
That ain't all she's gonna do,
Mama's gonna make a little coffee, too.

Mama's little baby loves short'nin', short'nin',
Mama's little baby loves short'nin' bread,
Mama's little baby loves short'nin', short'nin',
Mama's little baby loves short'nin' bread.

Click here for remaining lyrics and melody

TumbleBooks

Always - Alison McGhee

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Can you make up a recipe together and cook something fun? Try to use healthy ingredients!

Watch

Sesame Street: Cooking by the Numbers

Explore More

  • Make a Stone Soup Picture - Everyone in the family can add a vegetable to this art project that is almost good enough to eat!
  • Mister Rogers’ Recipes - Find tasty treats you and your family can make together!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 11
item.description:
I Went to the Beach

I went to the beach
And what did I see?
(Make binoculars with hands.)

A bird on the sand
Looking at me!
(Make beak with fingers over nose.)

I went to the beach
And what did I see?
(Make binoculars with hands.)

A fish in the water
Splashing at me!
(Wiggle one hand to imitate fish swimming.)

I went to the beach
And what did I see?
(Binoculars)

A shell in the sand
Sparkling at me!
(Raise hand to level of ears and wiggle fingers)

A crab in its shell
Waving at me!
(Make hands a shallow ‘C’ to imitate claws and wave side to side.)

Watch

Sleepy Caterpillars

Try This

Make up a short song about August and sing it together.

TumbleBooks

Fluffy: Scourge Of The Sea - Teresa Bateman

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Rub-a-Dub-Dub - Listen and sing along to this fun song.
  • Little Bunny Asks Why - Listen to this inspiring story about the little bunny who asks lots of questions to his family.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 10
item.description:
Sing a Song

Four White Horses

Four white horses, on the river,
Hey, hey, hey, up tomorrow,
Up tomorrow is a rainy day.
Come on up to the shallow bay,
Shallow bay is a ripe banana,
Up tomorrow is a rainy day.

For older children, this can become a hand clapping rhyme. If you have four people, try the instructions below. Otherwise, make up your own clapping game!

Four kids play: Two across from each other.
One pair goes high the other low then they alternate.
Clap partner, clap hands, clap partner, clap hands.
Then alternate. Do this for the first 4 lines.
Then for the last 2 lines - they can go to the side partner - clap side partner, clap hands (5th line).
Then the other side partner - clap side partner clap hands (6th line).

TumbleBooks

How I Became a Pirate - Melinda Long

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Do you have a broom or stick? Let your child pretend it is a horse and ride around the driveway or yard. Talk about horses and what your child knows or likes about them.

Watch

Put Your Finger In the Air

Explore More

  • Bomomo - Try your hand at Modern Art with bomomo.
  • Make a Horse on a Stick - Use a sock to make your very own horse on a stick.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 9
item.description:
Too Ra Loo Ra Loo Ral

Over in Killarney,
Many years ago,
My mother sang a song to me
In tones so sweet and low.
Just a simple little ditty,
In her good old Irish way,
And I'd give the world if she could sing
That song to me this day.

Too-ra-loo-ra-loo-ral,
Too-ra-loo-ra-li,
Too-ra-loo-ra-loo-ral,
Hush, now don't you cry!
Too-ra-loo-ra-loo-ral,
Too-ra-loo-ra-li,
Too-ra-loo-ra-loo-ral,
That's an Irish lullaby.

TumbleBooks

Miss Malarkey Won't Be in Today - Judy Finchler

Try This

Read half of a story together then let your child make up the ending.

Watch

The Jealous Bragging Turtle

item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 8
item.description:
Sing a Song

Dragon Song

Tune: My Bonnie

A dragon flew over our house
He landed right next to a tree
We asked him to stay for some dinner
And he ended up eating me.

Chorus
He ate, he ate, he ate me all up, all up.
He ate, he ate, he ate me all up.
It’s very dark inside a dragon
I didn’t like it at all
I started to tickle his tummy
He laughed from summer to fall.

The dragon got tired from laughing
His mouth opened and I ran out
“Don’t eat anymore little children,” I said.
He said, “Sorry,” and started to pout.

Watch

Top Ten Mythical Creatures

Try This

Together, draw a picture of an imaginary animal like a unicorn or dragon, or make up your own and name the animal.

TumbleBooks

Abra Cadabra and the Tooth Witch - Nurit Karlin

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Brushster - Make an online picture of your own imaginary animal with Brushster.
  • Photo Shoot - You can find and click on several imaginary creatures to learn more.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 7
item.description:
Kindergarten Here We Come!

Tune: Twinkle, Twinkle Little Star

Kindergarten, here we come!
We know we'll have lots of fun.
Lots of things to make and do.
Reading, writing, counting, too.
Kindergarten, here we come!
We know we'll have lots of fun.

TumbleBooks

Mom, The School Flooded - Ken Rivard

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Take out the Donald Crews books and let your child tell you a story to go with the pictures.

Watch

Sesame Street: Abby Starts School

Explore More

  • Sleeping Beauty - Listen to this beautifully illustrated version of the classic tale of Sleeping Beauty.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 6
item.description:
Sing a Song

Off To School We Go

Tune: A Hunting we will go

Off to school we go,
It's off to school we go,
We'll take our lunch and ride the bus,
With everyone we know.
Off to school we go,
It's off to school we go,
We learn our ABC's and more,
With everyone we know.

Watch

I Like the Flowers

Try This

Visit your library. Pick out a few favorite books. Will your child be going to school this year? If so, read Miss Bindergarten Gets Ready for Kindergarten and Miss Nelson is Missing. Take home books by Donald Crews for tomorrow.

TumbleBooks

First Day Jitters - Julie Danneberg

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Make an Alpha-Pockets Organizer - Here is a fun activity to learn the ABCs and to keep reinforcing words that begin with each letter.
  • Alphabet Crafts - Make art all about the ABCs! Try the pantry letters with beans, cereal, seeds, or other items from the kitchen.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 5
item.description:
Sing a Song

 

I'm a little teapot,
Short and stout,
Here is my handle
(one hand on hip)
Here is my spout
(other arm out with elbow and wrist bent)
When I get all steamed up,
Hear me shout,
Tip me over and pour me out!
(lean over toward spout)

Watch

I’m a Little Teapot

Try This

Have an imaginary tea party with your child.

TumbleBooks

50 Below Zero - Robert Munsch

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • I’m a Little Teapot Craft - This is a good craft to give to a family member who enjoys a cup of tea!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 4
item.description:
Sing a Song

That Spells Hats

tune: Frere Jacques

H-A-T-S
H-A-T-S
That spells hats
That spells hats
Everybody wears them
Everybody wears them
When they're cold.
When they're cold.

Can you add verses to the song with other reasons to wear hats?
Examples: to protect their heads, to shade their eyes, to keep them warm, when they dress up

TumbleBooks

Monster Mash - Mimi Maxwell

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Can you and your child make a hat out of things around the house?

Watch

Lights On Lights Out

Explore More

  • Make a Paper Bag Hat - Make a silly hat and decorate it any way you want. Go on a silly hat parade to show them off!
  • Newspaper Hat - Folded newspaper makes a great hat.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 3
item.description:
Sing a Song

Sing a Song of Sunshine

tune: Sing a Song of Sixpence

Sing a song of sunshine
Be happy every day
Sing a song of sunshine
You'll chase the clouds away
Be happy every moment
No matter what you do
Just sing and sing and sing and sing
And let the sunshine through!

TumbleBooks

The Moon Ring - Randy Duburke

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Go outside together, lie on the ground, and look up at the clouds. What do the clouds look like? Watch them move and keep saying what you see in the clouds.

Watch

The Land of Make Believe

Explore More

  • Make a Weather Gauge - Make a weather gauge, put it outside, and find out how much rain falls in your own yard.
  • Sunshine Handprint Craft - Make a colorful sun with your handprint. Everyone in the family can make their own.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 2
item.description:
I’ve Got Something in My Pocket

I’ve got something in my pocket that belongs across my face
I keep it very close to me in a most convenient place
Oh, I know you’ll never guess it if you guess a long, long while
So I’ll take it out and put it on. . .
It’s a great big happy smile.

Watch

Anansi Tries to Steal All the Wisdom in the World

Try This

Tell a story together. Take turns saying what will happen next.

TumbleBooks

My Brother, The Knight - Laura Discroll

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Make a Book - You can make your very own book. Try an accordion book, hot dog booklet, step book, and more.
  • Story Starters - Need a quick story idea? Spin the wheel for a great story prompt!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: August 1
item.description:
Sing a Song

Where Should I Live?

Where should I live?
In a castle with towers and a moat?
Or on a river in a houseboat?
A winter igloo made of ice may be just the thing
But what would happen when it turned to spring?
I like tall apartments and houses made of stone.
But I'd also like to live in a blue mobile home.
A cave or a cabin in the woods would give me lots of space
But I guess my home is the best place!

TumbleBooks

Castle On Hester Street - Linda Heller

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

With your child, make a fort or castle with pillows or blankets and play in it.

Watch

Georgina the Giraffe

Explore More

  • Make a Castle with Items Around the House - Make your very own castle out of cardboard, poster board, or even cereal boxes.
  • The Frog Prince - Listen to the classic story of a princess and a royal frog.
